sections.title:
Expenses payments within
the benefits code: scope
sections.body:
## Sections 70(1) and 72(1) ITEPA 2003

All sums paid in respect of expenses to a director or employee, whose employment is not an excluded employment ([EIM20007](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20001#EIM20007)), by reason of their employment (Section 70(1) ITEPA 2003) have to be treated as earnings chargeable to tax as employment income ([EIM00510](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00510)) unless:

*   they are otherwise chargeable to income tax ([EIM20602](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20600#EIM20602)) or
*   they are exempt ([EIM21240](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM21000#EIM21240)) or
*   they are paid in respect of expenses incurred in connection with a van or car to which a  van or car benefit applies ([EIM22725](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM22700#EIM22725) and [EIM23100](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM23000#EIM23100)) or
*   an Inspector has issued a dispensation in respect of them ([EIM30051](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM30050#EIM30051) onwards).

A sum paid in respect of expenses includes any sum put at the employee's disposal and paid away by him (Section 72(1) ITEPA 2003).

Where an employee makes a payment on behalf of his or her employer, see [EIM01110](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM01000#EIM01110).

sections.title:
Expenses payments
otherwise chargeable to income tax
sections.body:
Expenses payments are not chargeable by virtue of Section 70(1)
ITEPA 2003 if they are already chargeable by virtue of some other
provision (Section 70(5)).

For example, a round sum expenses allowance is chargeable on
all employees under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (Fergusson v Noble
7TC176) as earnings from the employment (
[EIM05100](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM04700#EIM05100)). So it is not chargeable under
Section 70(1).

The distinction is important for PAYE purposes. Tax is
deducted by the employer under PAYE from round sum allowances but
not from expenses payments falling within Sections 70 and 72, such
as scale rate payments (Donnelly v Williamson 54TC636). See booklet
CWG2.

sections.title:
Expenses payments
chargeable by virtue of Sections 70 to 72 ITEPA 2003
sections.body:
The expenses payments made to directors and employees, except
those in an excluded employment (
[EIM20007](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20001#EIM20007)), which are chargeable by
virtue of Sections 70(1) and 72(1) ITEPA 2003 include:

*   payments made to the employee to meet
particular expenses to be incurred
*   the reimbursement of expenses met from the
employee's own pocket
*   allowances related to specific expenses
such as payments in excess of the approved mileage allowance
payments calculated as a rate per mile (
[EIM31200](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM31200))
*   advance payments for expenses to be
incurred.

sections.title:
Expenses paid by an
employer to a third party
sections.body:
A payment made by an employer direct to a third party in respect
of expenses is not within Section 70(1) ITEPA 2003 because the
expenses are not paid
**to** the employee within the benefits code.

In these circumstances, the employer is providing the
employee with a benefit or facility chargeable under Part 3 Chapter
10 ITEPA 2003. But if the employer is discharging the employee's
own debt the charge will be under Section 62 ITEPA 2003 (
[EIM00580](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM00505#EIM00580) onwards).

sections.title:
Expenses payments
chargeable under Sections 22 or 26 ITEPA 2003
sections.body:
Where the earnings of a director or employee, except one in an
excluded employment (
[EIM20007](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20001#EIM20007)), are chargeable on remittance,
include expenses payments in the United Kingdom as chargeable
earnings as well as those remitted to the United Kingdom.

sections.title:
Example of deductions due
in respect of expenses payments received

Deductions due in respect
of expenses payments received
sections.body:
A director or employee, except one in an excluded employment (
[EIM20007](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20001#EIM20007)), can obtain a deduction in
respect of any expenses payments received which satisfy the
conditions of the following (all references to ITEPA 2003):

*   necessary expenses in Section 336 (
[EIM31620](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/EIM31620.htm) onwards)
*   various travel expenses in Sections 337 to
342 (
[EIM31800](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM31800) onwards)
*   professional fees and annual subscriptions
in Sections 343 and 344 (
[EIM32880](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM32700CT#EIM32880))
*   employee liabilities and indemnity
insurance in Section 346 (
[EIM30500](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM30500))
*   the expenses of ministers of religion in
Section 351 (

    [EIM60040](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM60000#EIM60040)) and
*   earnings charged on remittance in Section

    353 (

    [EIM40301](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM40000#EIM40301) onwards).

See example

[EIM20607](/guidance/employment-income-manual/EIM20607).
